title: THE SECRET SCOUT: The rise of Birmingham teenager Jude Bellingham
text:
Our scout is a top football expert who attends matches each week searching for the next star.

This week they give Sportsmail the low-down on Birmingham City starlet JUDE BELLINGHAM, who is now valued at £2.5million despite being just 16-years-old.

Here's just why the youngster, who has two goals from seven games this season, is catching the attention of many...

Birmingham teenager Jude Bellingham is the subject of the Secret Scout's focus this week

What has he got?

JUDE BELLINGHAM AGE: 16 CLUB: BIRMINGHAM POSITION: MIDFIELD VALUE: £2.5m 2019-20: APPS - 7, GOALS - 2

If this 16-year-old attacking midfielder can cope with increased compliments and stay calm, then he is destined for a long and successful career.

Having been catapulted into the first team, he will learn quickly in the hard knocks of Championship football.

Playing in the centre of a midfield four, he showed no nerves in a tough league game I saw. Indeed, when he was tackled heavily early he rode the challenge brilliantly with a cute side-step.

With a quick winger outside him he unselfishly fed him at every opportunity to expose a leaden-footed left back. But it was his skill that caught the eye. In one exquisite movement, for example, he switched the ball from left foot to right to left in a yard of space to slalom past another startled defender.

The 16-year-old has been catapulted into the first team but is coping with the demands

What also made me sit up was a run off the ball to take a defender from a wide position into the box, making space for a colleague’s pass to another player. That was outstanding. On top of that, when he failed with a one-two, he was alert to the danger and responsible enough to recover.

Against a 4-3-3, he and his central colleague captured the midfield. Bellingham can also wriggle out of challenges and has an eye for goal.

What does he need?

When a defender pulled him down after a bit of trickery, he took exception. It looks like he will have to manage a short fuse.

He coped physically on the whole, however, and though he was substituted, he did not look short of stamina.

It looks like he will have to manage a short fuse but Bellingham is a real talent

Very few people could imagine the brilliant Trevor Francis would have his record as Birmingham’s youngest debutant broken. But Bellingham has it now (16 years and 38 days).

This youngster looks to have the tools and the belief.

His progress now will depend on his character and some guidance to help him cope with this early fame.
